metadata.description: This parameter will be used as a suffix to uniquely identify the AKS Cluster. This suffix helps in organizing and distinguishing resources across different environments or executions of the script . E.g. poc, dev, prod, 04112024
Specifies the number of nodes (Azure VM instances) to launch in the AKS cluster node pool
Determines the Azure VM instance type for the nodes in the AKS cluster.

Whether to create a NAT Gateway or not. You will need the NAT Gateway when your private subnet don't have one yet, for connectivity to the Denodo Harbor repository and Azure Services. THIS WILL REPLACE THE DEFAULT OUTBOUND ACCESS IN YOUR PRIVATE SUBNET
ID of the Virtual Network where the AKS Cluster will be deployed
Name of the subnet where the AKS CLuster will be deployed

Specify whether the load balancer of the Denodo MPP is PRIVATE: It will require manual setup of Vnet Peering/other routing solution or PUBLIC: no setup needed but traffic will reach the internet. Set to 'true' to deploy a private load balancer, 'false' otherwise.
Property to enable using ROLE during registration instead of creating a new USER. If you are using AGORA you must set this property to true.

The container registry containing the Denodo Embedded MPP images. By default uses the denodo Harbor repository and requires that you fill the PullSecretValue or the DenodoHarborUser and DenodoHarborCLIPassword. If you want to use Azure Container Registry leave PullSecretValue empty and write your acr repository <acr_repository_name>.azurecr.io
Denodo harbor account username, required only when using harbor and you dont have a Pull Secret created
CLI secret in the Denodo Container Registry, required only when using harbor and you dont have a Pull Secret created
References the kubernetes secret with the credentials that will be used to download images from the Container registry, required if you are not using Azure image registry

The IP/hostname of your Denodo installation, could be private or public. If using a private IP, you have to ensure that this network is interconnected with the private subnet of the Cluster (using Vnet Peering or similar)

The IP/Hostname of your Denodo MPP installation, could be private or public. By default uses 'presto-denodo' hostname and it will be registering this hostname/IP in the denodo datasource, changing this parameter is common with Agora deployments but not needed most of the times. If using a private IP, you have to ensure that this network is interconnected with the private subnet of the Cluster (using Vnet Peering or similar)
The user name to create in your Denodo installation when you run ./cluster.sh register. It's replaced in the values.yaml and will allow presto to connect to Denodo. Default value is 'denodo_mpp_user'

The user password to create in your Denodo installation when you run ./cluster.sh register. It's replaced in the values.yaml and will allow presto to connect to Denodo. Default value is 'd3n0do_MPP_p*d'

properties.description: role definition for AKS service principal

properties.scriptContent: echo -e $template > deployment.json; az deployment sub create --name $deployment_name --location $location --template-file deployment.json --parameters aksManageClusterRoleAssignmentName=$aks_role_assignment_name aksManageClusterRoleDefintionName=$aks_role_definition_name managedIdentityPrincipalId=$managed_identity_principal_id

properties.description: role for the deployment script to list vnets

environmentVariables.name: check_role_assignment
environmentVariables.value:
#\!/bin/bash            
set -e
RETRY_COUNT=0
MAX_RETRIES=30
SLEEP_DURATION=10
while true; do
    if az network vnet list --output none; then
        echo 'Role assignment is effective.'
    break
    else
        RETRY_COUNT=$((RETRY_COUNT+1))
        if [ $RETRY_COUNT -ge $MAX_RETRIES ]; then
            echo 'Max retries reached. Role assignment not effective yet.'
            exit 1
        fi
        echo 'Role assignment not yet effective, retrying in '$SLEEP_DURATION' seconds...'
        sleep $SLEEP_DURATION
    fi
done

properties.scriptContent: echo -e "$check_role_assignment" > check_role_assignment.sh; ./check_role_assignment.sh ;ssh-keygen -m PEM -t rsa -b 4096 -f nodePoolKey -N ""; az keyvault secret set --vault-name $vault_name --name Den-nodePool-sshKey --file nodePoolKey --encoding ascii; ssh_public_key=$(cat nodePoolKey.pub); az network vnet list --query "[?resourceGuid=='$vnet_id'].{VNet: name, ResourceGroup: resourceGroup, Location: location, Subnets: subnets[?name=='$subnet_name'].{Name: name, AddressPrefixes: addressPrefixes, AddressPrefix: addressPrefix}}" --output json | jq --arg ssh_public_key "$ssh_public_key" '.[] | select(.Subnets) | {VNet: .VNet, ResourceGroup: .ResourceGroup, Location: .Location, SubnetName: .Subnets[].Name, CIDR: (.Subnets[].AddressPrefixes[0] // .Subnets[].AddressPrefix), SshKey:[{keyData: $ssh_public_key}]}' > $AZ_SCRIPTS_OUTPUT_PATH

environmentVariables.name: values_file
environmentVariables.value:
# Default values for prestocluster.

image:
  # -- Container Registry
  repository: "{{IMAGE_REPOSITORY}}"
  # --  Kubernetes imagePullPolicy value
  pullPolicy: IfNotPresent
  # -- Secret to use when pulling the image from the Container Registry
  # -- https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/pull-image-private-registry/
  # -- The alternative to creating the pullSecret, is to add the credentials to the Container Registry to the image.pullCredentials section
  # -- and let the Helm chart handle the creation of the secret.
  pullSecret: "{{PULL_SECRET}}"

  pullCredentials:
    # -- Whether to use the credentials in this section to create a secret to use when pulling the image from the Denodo Container Registry
    enabled: '{{PULL_CREDENTIALS_ENABLED}}'
    # -- Name of the secret to be created.
    name: "registry-secret"
    # -- Denodo Container Registry
    registry: "harbor.open.denodo.com"
    # -- Denodo account username
    username: "{{DENODO_HARBOR_USER}}"
    # -- CLI secret in the Denodo Container Registry
    pwd: "{{DENODO_HARBOR_CLI_PASSWORD}}"

# -- https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/security/service-accounts/
serviceAccount:
  # -- Whether to create a service account or not. If false, 'default' will be used
  create: true
  # -- service account name. If you do not specify it an autogenerated name will be used
  name: ""
  # -- Annotations for the Presto service account
  annotations: {}

objectStorage:
  aws:
    securityCredentials:
      enabled: false
  azure:
    managedIdentities:
      enabled: '{{USE_MANAGED_IDENTITY}}'
    oauth2ClientCredentials:
      enabled: false
    sharedKey:
      enabled: false
      account: ""
      blobStorage: false

common:
  # -- Common labels to add to the prestocluster.labels definition. To configure REMOVE the curly braces after 'podLabels:'.
  labels: {}

presto:
  # -- Number of Presto workers in the cluster
  numWorkers: '{{NUM_WORKERS}}'
  # -- Number of cores assigned to each worker
  cpusPerNode: '{{CPUS_PER_NODE}}'
  # -- Deprecated, the MPP now leverages Java container awareness:
  #  -- If memory limits are explicitly set (configured in the presto.coordinator.resources and presto.workers.resources sections in values.yaml), the JVMs heap size will allocate the 80% of those limits.
  #  -- If no memory limits are explicitly set, the JVMs heap size will allocate the 80% of the physical RAM available on the underlying Kubernetes node.
  # -- Total memory, in GB, assigned to each worker
  memoryPerNode: '{{MEMORY_PER_NODE}}'

  mppHost: "{{MPPHOST}}"

  service:
    # -- Presto service name
    name: presto
    # -- Service type: ClusterIP, NodePort or LoadBalancer
    type: LoadBalancer
    # -- Annotations for the Presto service. This is the recommended way to specify an IP address for the Service Type: LoadBalancer
    annotations: '{{PRESTO_ANNOTATIONS}}'
    # -- IP address for Presto service. Only applies to Service Type: LoadBalancer
    # -- Some cloud providers allow you to specify the loadBalancerIP. In those cases, the load-balancer is created
    # -- with the user-specified loadBalancerIP. If the loadBalancerIP field is not specified, the loadBalancer is
    # -- set up with an ephemeral IP address. If you specify a loadBalancerIP but your cloud provider does not support
    # -- the feature, the loadbalancerIP field that you set is ignored.
    loadBalancerIP: ""
    # -- List of IPs to restrict traffic through the load balancer. Only applies to Service Type: LoadBalancer.
    # -- This field is ignored if the cloud-provider does not support the feature.
    loadBalancerSourceRanges: []
    # -- The port of the HTTP endpoint that the service listens to on the host, for the `NodePort` type.
    # -- If not set, Kubernetes will allocate a port automatically. Ranges between 30000 and 32767 must be used
    # -- to avoid conflicts with reserved ports and ports used by nodes.
    httpnodePort: ""
    # -- The port of the HTTPS endpoint that the service listens to on the host, for the `NodePort` type.
    # -- If not set, Kubernetes will allocate a port automatically. Ranges between 30000 and 32767 must be used
    # -- to avoid conflicts with reserved ports and ports used by nodes.
    httpsnodePort: ""


  coordinator:
    # -- Presto coordinator deployment name
    name: presto-coordinator
    # -- Presto Coordinator HTTPS endpoint port
    serverHttpsPort: 8443
    # -- Presto Coordinator HTTP endpoint port
    serverHttpPort: 8080
    # -- Presto Coordinator annotations to add to the coordinator deployment. To configure REMOVE the curly braces after 'annotations:'.
    annotations: {}
    # -- Presto Coordinator annotations to add to the coordinator deployment Pod specifications. To configure REMOVE the curly braces after 'annotations:'.
    podAnnotations: {}

    passwordAuth:
      # -- Username
      prestoUser: "presto"
      # -- Password for the username
      prestoPassword: "pr3st%"

    # -- Enables the Resource management in Presto
    resourceGroups: false

    # -- Entries for extra config properties
    additionalConfig: []

    securityContext:
      # -- Forces to run as a non-root user to ensure least privilege
      runAsNonRoot: true

    containerSecurityContext:
      # -- Ensures that no child process of a container can gain more privileges than its parent
      allowPrivilegeEscalation: false
      # -- Drops all capabilities (kernel level calls)
      capabilities:
        drop:
          - ALL

    # -- Resource requests and limits for the Presto Coordinator
    resources: {}
      # Resources are not configured by default, as we leave this setting as a conscious choice for the user.
      # If you do want to specify resources, uncomment the following
      # lines, adjust them as necessary, and REMOVE the curly braces after 'resources:'.
      # limits:
      #   cpu: 0.8
      #   memory: 100Gi
      # requests:
      #   cpu: 0.7
      #   memory: 90Gi

    # -- Presto Coordinator node labels for pod scheduling
    nodeSelector: {}

    # -- Presto Coordinator affinity
    affinity: {}

    # -- Presto Coordinator tolerations
    tolerations: []

    # -- Topology constraints for the Presto Coordinator
    topologySpreadConstraints:
      # This configuration distributes pods in an absolute even manner (maxSkew),
      # using the hostname as topology domain (topologyKey),
      # scheduling pods even if it can't satisfy even distribution of pods (whenUnsatisfiable),
      # acting on Pods that match this selector (labelSelector).
      - maxSkew: 1
        topologyKey: kubernetes.io/hostname
        whenUnsatisfiable: ScheduleAnyway
        labelSelector:
          matchExpressions:
            - {key: app, operator: In, values: [presto-coordinator, presto-worker]}

    livenessreadiness:
      enabled: true
    livenessProbe:
      initialDelaySeconds: 20
      periodSeconds: 10
      timeoutSeconds: 5
      failureThreshold: 6
      successThreshold: 1
    readinessProbe:
      initialDelaySeconds: 20
      periodSeconds: 10
      timeoutSeconds: 5
      failureThreshold: 6
      successThreshold: 1

    env:
      # additional environment variables for coordinator
      # NAME: VALUE

    additionalVolumes: {}
      # Additional volumes to add to the coordinator. To configure REMOVE the curly braces after 'additionalVolumes:'.
      #
      #- name: cache-volume
      #  emptyDir: {}

    additionalVolumeMounts: {}
      # Additional volume mounts to add to the coordinator. To configure REMOVE the curly braces after 'additionalVolumeMounts:'.
      #
      #- name: cache-volume
      #  mountPath: /opt/data/alluxio

  worker:
    # -- Presto worker deployment name
    name: presto-worker

    # -- Presto Worker HTTP endpoint port
    serverHttpPort: 8080
    # -- Presto Worker annotations to add to the worker deployment. To configure REMOVE the curly braces after 'annotations:'.
    annotations: {}
    # -- Presto Worker annotations to add to the worker deployment Pod specifications. To configure REMOVE the curly braces after 'annotations:'.
    podAnnotations: {}

    # -- Entries for extra config properties
    additionalConfig: []

    securityContext:
      # -- Force to run as a non-root user to ensure least privilege
      runAsNonRoot: true

    containerSecurityContext:
      # -- Ensures that no child process of a container can gain more privileges than its parent
      allowPrivilegeEscalation: false
      # -- Drops all capabilities (kernel level calls)
      capabilities:
        drop:
          - ALL

    # -- Resource requests and limits for the Presto Workers
    resources: {}
      # Resources are not configured by default, as we leave this setting as a conscious choice for the user.
      # If you do want to specify resources, uncomment the following
      # lines, adjust them as necessary, and REMOVE the curly braces after 'resources:'.
      # limits:
      #   cpu: 0.8
      #   memory: 100Gi
      # requests:
      #   cpu: 0.7
      #   memory: 90Gi

    # -- Presto Workers node labels for pod scheduling
    nodeSelector: {}

    # -- Presto Workers affinity
    affinity: {}

    # -- Presto Workers tolerations
    tolerations: []

    # -- Topology constraints for the Presto Workers
    topologySpreadConstraints:
      # This configuration distributes pods in an absolute even manner (maxSkew),
      # using the hostname as topology domain (topologyKey),
      # scheduling pods even if it can't satisfy even distribution of pods (whenUnsatisfiable),
      # acting on Pods that match this selector (labelSelector).
      - maxSkew: 1
        topologyKey: kubernetes.io/hostname
        whenUnsatisfiable: ScheduleAnyway
        labelSelector:
          matchExpressions:
            - {key: app, operator: In, values: [presto-coordinator, presto-worker]}

    livenessreadiness:
      enabled: true
    livenessProbe:
      initialDelaySeconds: 20
      periodSeconds: 10
      timeoutSeconds: 5
      failureThreshold: 6
      successThreshold: 1
    readinessProbe:
      initialDelaySeconds: 20
      periodSeconds: 10
      timeoutSeconds: 5
      failureThreshold: 6
      successThreshold: 1

    # It is strongly recommended to enable Graceful shutdown when using autoscaling for minimizing disruptions during scale-down operations.
    # If enabled workers will no longer receive new tasks, and will wait the configured Grace Period to allow time for the completion of tasks in progress.
    gracefulShutdown:
      enabled: false
      gracePeriodSeconds: 120
    # When gracefulShutdown is enabled, the user must set the presto.worker.terminationGracePeriodSeconds to a value of at least two times the configured 'gracePeriodSeconds'
    terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 30

    env:
      # additional environment variables for workers
      # NAME: VALUE

    additionalVolumes: {}
      # Additional volumes to add to the workers. To configure REMOVE the curly braces after 'additionalVolumes:'.
      #
      #- name: cache-volume
      #  emptyDir: {}

    additionalVolumeMounts: {}
      # Additional volume mounts to add to the workers. To configure REMOVE the curly braces after 'additionalVolumeMounts:'.
      #
      #- name: cache-volume
      #  mountPath: /opt/data/alluxio

  jvm:
    # -- Entries for extra JVM config properties
    additionalJVMConfig: []

  log:
    # -- Log level for com.facebook.presto
    facebook: ERROR
    # -- Log level for org.apache.hadoop
    hadoop: ERROR
    # -- Entries for extra log categories
    additionalLogs: []

  node:
    # --  Name of the environment
    environment: "production"
    # --  Location where Presto will store logs and other data
    dataDir: "/var/presto/data"

  # -- Connection details to Denodo. Denodo will use Presto to accelerate queries
  denodoConnector:
    # -- Denodo server uri
    server: "//{{DENODO_IP}}:9999/admin_denodo_mpp"
    # -- i18n configuration of the connection with Denodo
    i18n: "us_utc_iso"
    # -- Denodo user
    user: "{{DENODO_USER}}"
    # -- Denodo password, must be compliant with Denodo password policies
    password: "{{DENODO_PASSWORD}}"
    # -- Maximum number of results that a block can contain. When Denodo obtains enough results to complete a block, it sends this block to Presto and continues processing the next results. Default value is 100000
    chunkSize: "100000"
    # -- Maximum time, in milliseconds, Denodo waits before returning a new block to Presto. Default value is 90000 ms
    chunkTimeout: "90000"
    # -- Maximum time, in milliseconds, Presto will wait for a Denodo query to finish. If it is not set default value is 900000 ms
    queryTimeout: "900000"
    # -- Whether SSL is enabled in Denodo server
    ssl: false
    # -- File name of trust store file that contains the SSL certificates. File should be placed in the 'presto' directory.
    trustStore: ""
    # -- Password of the trust store
    trustStorePassword: ""
    # -- Name of the infrastructure provider (On-premises, AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, Alibaba, etc.) where the client and Virtual DataPort server is running.
    infrastructureProvider: ""
    # -- Name of the infrastructure provider region where the client and Virtual DataPort server is running.
    infrastructureRegion: ""
    # -- Property to enable using ROLE during registration instead of creating a new USER. If you are using AGORA you must set this property to true.
    useRole: '{{USE_ROLE}}'
    # -- Denodo role
    role: "embedded_mpp_role"

  # -- Hive catalog configuration: for accessing Hive tables over Parquet files
  hive:
    # -- Timeout for Hive metastore requests
    hiveMetastoreTimeout: 20s
    # -- S3 storage endpoint server used to connect to an S3-compatible storage system instead of AWS
    s3Endpoint: ""
    # -- Enable S3 path style access to connect to an S3-compatible storage system instead of AWS
    s3PathStyleAccess: false
    # -- File should be placed in 'presto/secrets' and in 'hive-metastore/secrets' directories.
    gcsKeyFile: ""
    # -- Enables vectorized readings in parquet
    parquetBatchReadOptimizationEnabled: true
    # -- Enables pushdown filter
    pushdownFilterEnabled: true
    # -- Obtains statistics from metadata for tables/partitions with missing statistics
    quickStats: true
    # -- Limit on the number of splits waiting to be served by a split source. After reaching this limit,
    # -- writers will stop writing new splits until some of them are used by workers. Higher values will increase memory usage,
    # -- but allow IO to be concentrated at one time, which may be faster and increase resource utilization.
    maxOutstandingSplits: 1800
    # --  This property describes how many splits may be initially created for a single query using
    # -- hive.max-initial-split-size instead of hive.max-split-size.
    #The purpose of the smaller split size for the initial splits is to increase concurrency for smaller queries.
    maxInitialSplits: 600
    # -- This property describes the maximum size of the first hive.max-initial-splits splits created for a query.
    # -- Lower values will increase concurrency for small queries. This property represents the maximum size,
    # -- as the real size may be lower when the amount of data to read is less than hive.max-initial-split-size.
    maxInitialSplitSize: 128MB
    # -- The maximum size of splits created after the initial splits. A higher value will reduce parallelism.
    # -- This may be desirable for very large queries and a stable cluster because it allows for more efficient
    # -- processing of local data without the context switching, synchronization and data collection that result from parallelization.
    # -- The optimal value should be aligned with the average query size in the system.
    maxSplitSize: 256MB
    # -- Increase split loader concurrency could lead to some individual queries see 2x, 3x improvement
    splitLoaderConcurrency: 32
    # -- mestastore cache configuration. metastore cache is DISABLED by default (ttl 0s).
    # -- To enable it, you need to configure a valid value in ttl.
    cache:
      metastore:
        scope: "ALL"
        ttl: "0s"
        interval: "3d"
        maxSize: "10000000"
    # -- Entries for extra config properties for catalog
    additionalConfig: []

  # -- Iceberg catalog configuration: for accessing Iceberg tables
  iceberg:
    # -- Timeout for Hive metastore requests
    hiveMetastoreTimeout: 20s
    # -- S3 storage endpoint server used to connect to an S3-compatible storage system instead of AWS
    s3Endpoint: ""
    # -- Enable S3 path style access to connect to an S3-compatible storage system instead of AWS
    s3PathStyleAccess: false
    # -- File should be placed in 'presto/secrets' and in 'hive-metastore/secrets' directories.
    gcsKeyFile: ""
    # -- Enables vectorized readings in parquet
    parquetBatchReadOptimizationEnabled: true
    # -- Enables pushdown filter
    pushdownFilterEnabled: true
    # -- Entries for extra config properties for catalog
    additionalConfig: []

  # -- Delta catalog configuration: for accessing Delta tables
  delta:
    # -- Timeout for Hive metastore requests
    hiveMetastoreTimeout: 20s
    # -- S3 storage endpoint server used to connect to an S3-compatible storage system instead of AWS
    s3Endpoint: ""
    # -- Enable S3 path style access to connect to an S3-compatible storage system instead of AWS
    s3PathStyleAccess: false
    # -- File should be placed in 'presto/secrets' and in 'hive-metastore/secrets' directories.
    gcsKeyFile: ""
    # -- Enables vectorized readings in parquet
    parquetBatchReadOptimizationEnabled: true
    # -- Enables pushdown filter
    pushdownFilterEnabled: true
    # -- Entries for extra config properties for catalog
    additionalConfig: []

  # -- Additional catalogs, as an example the jmx catalog provides JMX information from all nodes in the cluster.
  catalog:
    #jmx: |-
    #  connector.name=jmx
    #
    #glue-hive: |-
    #  connector.name=hive-hadoop2
    #  hive.metastore=glue
    #  hive.metastore.glue.region=
    #  hive.metastore.glue.catalogid=
    #  hive.metastore.glue.aws-access-key=
    #  hive.metastore.glue.aws-secret-key=
    #  hive.config.resources=core-site.xml
    #  hive.parquet.use-column-names=true
    #
    #glue-iceberg: |-
    #  connector.name=iceberg
    #  iceberg.catalog.type=HIVE
    #  hive.metastore=glue
    #  hive.metastore.glue.region=
    #  hive.metastore.glue.catalogid=
    #  hive.metastore.glue.aws-access-key=
    #  hive.metastore.glue.aws-secret-key=
    #  hive.config.resources=core-site.xml
    #  hive.parquet.use-column-names=true
    #
    #glue-delta: |-
    #  connector.name=delta
    #  hive.metastore=glue
    #  hive.metastore.glue.region=
    #  hive.metastore.glue.catalogid=
    #  hive.metastore.glue.aws-access-key=
    #  hive.metastore.glue.aws-secret-key=
    #  hive.config.resources=core-site.xml
    #  hive.parquet.use-column-names=true

  # -- Enables autoscale creating a HorizontalPodScaler
  autoscaling:
      # If you want to autoscale based on a resource's utilization as a percentage, you must specify
      # requests for that resource in the 'presto.worker.resources' parameter of this file.
      # This example creates HorizontalPodAutoscaler object to autoscale the Presto Deployment when
      # CPU utilization surpasses 80%, and ensures that there is always a minimum of
      # presto.numWorkers replica and a maximum of 20 replicas.
    enabled: false
    maxReplicas: 20
    targetCPUUtilizationPercentage: 80
      # -- Entries for scaling up and down configuration
    behavior: {}
      #  scaleDown:
      #    stabilizationWindowSeconds: 300
      #    policies:
      #    - type: Percent
      #      value: 100
      #      periodSeconds: 15
      #  scaleUp:
      #    stabilizationWindowSeconds: 0
      #    policies:
      #    - type: Percent
      #      value: 100
      #      periodSeconds: 15
      #    - type: Pods
      #      value: 4
      #      periodSeconds: 15
      #    selectPolicy: Max

  # -- Ingress exposes HTTP(S) routes from outside the cluster to services within the cluster.
  # -- Traffic routing is controlled by rules that define which inbound connections reach which services.
  # -- In order for the Ingress resource to work, the cluster must have an ingress controller running, like NGINX Ingress Controller.
  ingress:
    enabled: false
    # -- Presto ingress name
    name: presto-ingress
    # -- Annotations for the Presto ingress
    annotations: {}
    # -- If the ingressClassName is omitted, a default Ingress class should be defined.
    className: ""
    # -- Hostname for Ingress
    host: ""
    # -- Port for Ingress
    ingressPort: 443
    # -- URL path which is used for routing. Only requests to this path will be forwarded to the service
    path: /
    # -- Supported path types: ImplementationSpecific, Exact, Prefix
    pathType: ImplementationSpecific
    # -- Enable/disable TLS
    tls:
      enabled: true
      # -- `name` will only be used, if `create` is set to false to bind an existing secret that contains the key/certificate for TLS
      secretName: ""
      create: false
      # -- File name of the certificate file, required if `create` is set to true. File should be placed in the 'presto' directory.
      certFile: ""
      # -- File name of the private key file, required if `create` is set to true. File should be placed in the 'presto' directory.
      keyFile: ""

  config:
    # -- Dynamic filtering optimizations significantly improve the performance of queries with selective
    # -- joins by avoiding reading of data that would be filtered by join condition.
    enableDynamicFiltering: true

    # -- Enables the optimizer to use histograms when available to perform cost estimate calculations during
    # -- query optimization. When set to false, this parameter prevents histograms from being collected by ANALYZE,
    # -- and also prevents the existing histograms from being used during query optimization.
    # -- (only supported for Iceberg tables)
    useHistograms: false
    # -- This controls the maximum estimated size of a table that can be broadcast when using `AUTOMATIC` join distribution type.
    # -- This allows improving cluster concurrency and prevents bad plans when CBO misestimates size of joined tables.
    joinMaxBroadcastTableSize: 615MB
    # -- Eabling optimized repartitioning should show CPU performance improvement
    optimizedRepartitioning: true
    # -- With the automatic strategy the optimizer decides for each aggregation, e.g: disable partial aggregation when size reduction is below threshold
    partialAggregationStrategy: automatic
    # -- Infer predicates from column domains during predicate pushdown. These generated predicates can significantly
    # -- reduce input data scanned, thereby reducing execution cost.
    generateDomainFilters: true
    # -- Choose http-server.threads.max
    httpServerThreadsMax: 1000
    # -- node-scheduler.max-splits-per-node limits the number of splits that can be scheduled for each node.
    # -- Increasing this value will allow the cluster to process more queries or reduce visibility of problems connected to data skew.
    # -- Excessively high values may result in poor performance due to context switching and higher memory reservation for cluster metadata.
    maxPendingSplitsPerTask: 2000
    # -- Choose max-splits-per-node
    maxSplitsPerNode: 2000
    # -- Choose max-splits-per-node
    minScheduleSplitBatchSize: 2000
    # -- Increasing this value may improve network throughput for data transferred between stages, 
    # -- if the network has high latency, or if there are many nodes in the cluster.
    sinkMaxBufferSize: 1GB
    # -- This feature improvs efficiency of coordinator when running a large number of tasks.
    enableEventLoop: true


metastore:
  # -- Use the internal Hive Metastore. Default is true.
  enabled: true
  # -- JDBC connection string of the RDBMS of the Hive Metastore. Default is the internal PostgreSQL's URL
  connectionUrl: "jdbc:postgresql://postgresql:5432/metastore"
  # -- If you want to use a different schema you need to add the currentSchema parameter in the connectionUrl to specify the schema to be set in the search-path
  # connectionUrl: "jdbc:postgresql://postgresql:5432/metastore?currentSchema=schema"
  # connectionUrl: "jdbc:mysql://HOST:3306/metastore"
  # connectionUrl: "jdbc:sqlserver://HOST:1433;DatabaseName=metastore"
  # connectionUrl: "jdbc:oracle:thin:@//HOST:1521/ORCLPDB1"

  # -- JDBC Driver class name to connect with the RDBMS of the Hive Metastore. Default is the internal PostgreSQL's driver
  connectionDriverName: "org.postgresql.Driver"
  # connectionDriverName: "org.mariadb.jdbc.Driver"
  # connectionDriverName: "com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerDriver"
  # connectionDriverName: "oracle.jdbc.OracleDriver"

  # -- Database to connect with the RDBMS of the Hive Metastore. Required for PostgreSQL's database only
  connectionDatabase: "metastore"

  # -- Schema to connect with the RDBMS of the Hive Metastore. Required for PostgreSQL's database only
  connectionSchema: public

  # -- User to connect with the RDBMS of the Hive Metastore. Default is hive
  connectionUser: "hive"

  # -- Password to connect with the RDBMS of the Hive Metastore. Default is hive
  connectionPassword: "hive"

  # -- Classpath to the JDBC drivers of the Hive Metastore
  driversPath: "/opt/hive/jdbc-drivers"

  maxHeapSize: 2048

  service:
    # -- Hive Metastore service name
    name: hive-metastore
    # -- Hive Metastore port
    port: 9083
    # -- Hive Metastore annotations to add to the metastore service. To configure REMOVE the curly braces after 'annotations:'.
    annotations: {}
  deployment:
    # -- Hive Metastore deployment name
    name: hive-metastore
    # -- Hive Metastore port
    port: 9083
    # -- Hive Metastore annotations to add to the metastore deployment. To configure REMOVE the curly braces after 'annotations:'.
    annotations: {}
    # -- Hive Metastore annotations to add to the metastore deployment Pod specifications. To configure REMOVE the curly braces after 'annotations:'.
    podAnnotations: {}
  livenessreadiness:
    enabled: true
  livenessProbe:
    initialDelaySeconds: 25
    periodSeconds: 10
    timeoutSeconds: 5
    failureThreshold: 6
    successThreshold: 1
  readinessProbe:
    initialDelaySeconds: 25
    periodSeconds: 10
    timeoutSeconds: 5
    failureThreshold: 6
    successThreshold: 1

  env:
    # additional environment variables for metastore
    # NAME: VALUE

  additionalVolumes: {}
    # Additional volumes to add to the metastore. To configure REMOVE the curly braces after 'additionalVolumes:'.
    #
    #- name: my-volume
    #  emptyDir: {}

  additionalVolumeMounts: {}
    # Additional volume mounts to add to the metastore. To configure REMOVE the curly braces after 'additionalVolumeMounts:'.
    #
    #- name: my-volume
    #  mountPath: /path/on/host

  # -- Hive Metastore node labels for pod scheduling
  nodeSelector: {}

  # -- Hive Metastore inter-pod affinity, that allows you to schedule pods based on their relationship to other pods
  affinity:
    # Run Hive Metastore on the same machine as PostgreSQL
    # to improve performance, avoid network latency issues and connection failures
    podAffinity:
      requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution:
        - labelSelector:
            matchExpressions:
              - {key: app, operator: In, values: [hive-metastore, postgresql]}
          topologyKey: kubernetes.io/hostname
    # ensure it runs on different machines than presto, if possible
    podAntiAffinity:
      preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution:
        - weight: 100
          podAffinityTerm:
            labelSelector:
              matchExpressions:
                - {key: app, operator: In, values: [presto-coordinator, presto-worker]}
            topologyKey: "kubernetes.io/hostname"

  # -- Hive Metastore tolerations
  tolerations: []

  # -- Topology constraints for Hive Metastore
  topologySpreadConstraints: []

  securityContext:
    # -- Force to run as a non-root user to ensure least privilege
    runAsNonRoot: true

  containerSecurityContext:
    # -- Ensures that no child process of a container can gain more privileges than its parent
    allowPrivilegeEscalation: false
    # -- Drops all capabilities (kernel level calls)
    capabilities:
      drop:
        - ALL
  # -- Resource requests and limits for the Hive Metastore
  resources: {}
    # Resources are not configured by default, as we leave this setting as a conscious choice for the user.
    # If you do want to specify resources, uncomment the following
    # lines, adjust them as necessary, and REMOVE the curly braces after 'resources:'.
    # limits:
    #   cpu: 0.8
    #   memory: 100Gi
    # requests:
    #   cpu: 0.7
    #   memory: 90Gi

postgresql:
  # -- Whether to use an internal PostgreSQL or an external RDBMS for the Hive Metastore. Default is true.
  enabled: true

  # -- Deprecated, PostgreSQL 15 was introduced in version 20240506, so this warning will be removed in a future release.
  # -- Whether to warn about the need of perform a manual backup of the Embedded PostgreSQL due to the major version upgrade.
  version15BackupWarning: true

  service:
    # -- PostgreSQL service name
    name: postgresql
    # -- PostgreSQL port
    port: 5432
    # -- PostgreSQL annotations to add to the postgresql service. To configure REMOVE the curly braces after 'annotations:'.
    annotations: {}
  deployment:
    # -- PostgreSQL deployment name
    name: postgresql
    # -- PostgreSQL port
    port: 5432
    # -- PostgreSQL annotations to add to the postgresql deployment. To configure REMOVE the curly braces after 'annotations:'.
    annotations: {}
    # -- PostgreSQL annotations to add to the postgresql deployment Pod specifications. To configure REMOVE the curly braces after 'annotations:'.
    podAnnotations: {}
  livenessreadiness:
    enabled: true
  livenessProbe:
    initialDelaySeconds: 5
    periodSeconds: 10
    timeoutSeconds: 5
    failureThreshold: 6
    successThreshold: 1
  readinessProbe:
    initialDelaySeconds: 5
    periodSeconds: 10
    timeoutSeconds: 5
    failureThreshold: 6
    successThreshold: 1

  env:
    # additional environment variables for PostgreSQL
    # NAME: VALUE

  additionalVolumes: {}
    # Additional volumes to add to the PostgreSQL. To configure REMOVE the curly braces after 'additionalVolumes:'.
    #
    #- name: my-volume
    #  emptyDir: {}

  additionalVolumeMounts: {}
    # Additional volume mounts to add to the PostgreSQL. To configure REMOVE the curly braces after 'additionalVolumeMounts:'.
    #
    #- name: my-volume
    #  mountPath: /path/on/host

  pvClaim:
    # -- Annotations for the Persistent Volume Claim
    annotations: {}
      # If you do want to specify annotations, uncomment the following lines,
      # adjust them as necessary, and REMOVE the curly braces after 'annotations:'.

      # Add the following annotation if you want to preserve Presto metadata after cluster removal
      # "helm.sh/resource-policy": keep


    # -- Storage size requested for the PostgreSQL's volume
    storage: 5Gi
    # -- Persistent Volume Claim Storage the for PostgreSQL's volume
    storageClassName: "{{STORAGE_CLASS_NAME}}"

  # -- PostgreSQL node labels for pod scheduling
  nodeSelector: {}

  # -- PostgreSQL inter-pod affinity, that allows you to schedule pods based on their relationship to other pods
  affinity:
    # Run PostgreSQL on the same machine as Hive Metastore
    # to improve performance, avoid network latency issues and connection failures
    podAffinity:
      requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution:
        - labelSelector:
            matchExpressions:
              - {key: app, operator: In, values: [hive-metastore, postgresql]}
          topologyKey: kubernetes.io/hostname

  # -- PostgreSQL tolerations
  tolerations: []

  # -- Topology constraints for PostgreSQL
  topologySpreadConstraints: []

  securityContext:
    # -- Force to run as a non-root user to ensure the least privilege
    runAsNonRoot: true
    # -- User ID for the container. Ignored on OpenShift.
    runAsUser: 1001
    # -- Group ID for the pod volumes. Ignored on OpenShift
    fsGroup: 1001
    fsGroupChangePolicy: OnRootMismatch

  containerSecurityContext:
    # -- Ensures that no child process of a container can gain more privileges than its parent
    allowPrivilegeEscalation: false
    # -- Drops all capabilities (kernel level calls)
    capabilities:
      drop:
        - ALL
  # -- Resource requests and limits for postgresql
  resources: {}
    # Resources are not configured by default, as we leave this setting as a conscious choice for the user.
    # If you do want to specify resources, uncomment the following
    # lines, adjust them as necessary, and REMOVE the curly braces after 'resources:'.
    # limits:
    #   cpu: 0.8
    #   memory: 100Gi
    # requests:
    #   cpu: 0.7
    #   memory: 90Gi

initCacertContainer:
  resources: {}
    # Resources are not configured by default, as we leave this setting as a conscious choice for the user.
    # If you do want to specify resources, uncomment the following
    # lines, adjust them as necessary, and REMOVE the curly braces after 'resources:'.
    # limits:
    #   cpu: 0.2
    #   memory: 1Gi
    # requests:
    #   cpu: 0.2
    #   memory: 1Gi

# Metrics endpoint to export JMX metrics in Prometheus format
metrics:
  prometheus:
    enabled: false
    port: 8081
    # JMX Exporter config, see https://github.com/prometheus/jmx_exporter#configuration for available options
    config:
      rules:
        - pattern: 'java.lang<type=Memory><(.*)>'
        - pattern: 'java.lang<type=GarbageCollector, name=(.*)><(.*)>'
        - pattern: 'java.lang<type=Threading><(.*)>'
        - pattern: 'java.lang<type=OperatingSystem><(.*)>'

        - pattern: 'com.facebook.presto.execution<name=(.*)><(.*)>'
          name: "presto_execution_$2"
          labels:
            query: "$1"
          type: GAUGE

        - pattern: 'com.facebook.presto.execution<type=QueryManager><>(.*)'
          name: "presto_execution_querymanager_$1"
          type: GAUGE

        - pattern: 'com.facebook.presto.sql<name=(.*)><(.*)>'
          name: "presto_sql_$2"
          labels:
            query: "$1"
          type: GAUGE

        - pattern: ".*"
          action: "drop"
  otel:
    enabled: false
    # OTEL jvm config, see https://opentelemetry.io/docs/zero-code/java/agent/configuration/ for available configuration
    config: ["-Dotel.service.name=DenodoMPPOtel", "-Dotel.service.version=1.0", "-Dotel.exporter.otlp.protocol=grpc",
      "-Dotel.exporter.otlp.endpoint=http://host:4317", "-Dotel.logs.exporter=otlp"]

environmentVariables.name: edit_values_script
environmentVariables.value:
#\!/bin/bash

# Function to display usage
usage() {
  echo "Usage: $0 [--input-file <input_file>] [--image-registry-name <imageRegistryName>] [--aks-node-count <aksNodeCount>] [--private-load-balancer <privateLoadBalancer>] [--pull-secret-value <pullSecretValue>] [--denodo-harbor-user <DenodoHarborUser>] [--denodo-harbor-cli-password <DenodoHarborCLIPassword>] [--denodo-ip <denodoIP>] [--denodo-user <DenodoUser>] [--denodo-password <DenodoPassword>] [--vm-size <vmSize>] [--storage-class-name <storageClassName>] [--use-role <useRole>] [--mpphost <MppHost>]"
  exit 1
}

# Initialize variables
input_file=""
image_registry_name=""
aks_node_count=""
private_load_balancer=""
use_role=""
pull_secret_value=""
denodo_harbor_user=""
denodo_harbor_cli_password=""
denodo_ip=""
mpphost=""
denodo_user=""
denodo_password=""
vm_size=""
storage_class_name=""

# Parse named parameters
while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
  key="$1"
  case $key in
    --input-file)
      input_file="$2"
      shift # past argument
      shift # past value
      ;;
    --image-registry-name)
      image_registry_name="$2"
      shift
      shift
      ;;
    --aks-node-count)
      aks_node_count="$2"
      shift
      shift
      ;;
    --private-load-balancer)
      private_load_balancer="$2"
      shift
      shift
      ;;
    --pull-secret-value)
      pull_secret_value="$2"
      shift
      shift
      ;;
    --denodo-harbor-user)
      denodo_harbor_user="$2"
      shift
      shift
      ;;
    --denodo-harbor-cli-password)
      denodo_harbor_cli_password="$2"
      shift
      shift
      ;;
    --denodo-ip)
      denodo_ip="$2"
      shift
      shift
      ;;
    --denodo-user)
      denodo_user="$2"
      shift
      shift
      ;;
    --denodo-password)
      denodo_password="$2"
      shift
      shift
      ;;
    --vm-size)
      vm_size="$2"
      shift
      shift
      ;;
    --storage-class-name)
      storage_class_name="$2"
      shift
      shift
      ;;
    --use-role)
      use_role="$2"
      shift
      shift
      ;;
    --mpphost)
      mpphost="$2"
      shift
      shift
      ;;
    *)
      echo "Invalid option: $1" 1>&2
      usage
      ;;
  esac
done

# Check if input file is provided
if [ -z "$input_file" ]; then
  echo "Input file is required."
  usage
fi

# Check if input file exists
if [ ! -f "$input_file" ]; then
  echo "Input file not found!"
  exit 1
fi

# Function to update image registry in YAML
update_image_registry() {
  local registry="$1"
  sed -i "s|{{IMAGE_REPOSITORY}}|${registry}|" "$input_file"
}

# Function to update AKS node count in YAML
update_aks_node_count() {
  local count="$1"
  if [ -n "$count" ]; then
    local num_workers=$((count - 2))
    # Ensure numWorkers is at least 1
    if [ "$num_workers" -lt 1 ]; then
      num_workers=1
    fi
    sed -i "s|'{{NUM_WORKERS}}'|${num_workers}|" "$input_file"
  fi
}

# Function to update private load balancer annotation
update_private_load_balancer() {
  local private_lb="$1"
  if [ "$private_lb" = "true" ]; then
    sed -i "s|'{{PRESTO_ANNOTATIONS}}'|{service.beta.kubernetes.io/azure-load-balancer-internal: \"true\"}|" "$input_file"
  else
    sed -i "s|'{{PRESTO_ANNOTATIONS}}'|{}|" "$input_file"
  fi
}

# Function to update pullSecret in YAML
update_pull_secret_value() {
  local secret_value="$1"
  sed -i "s|{{PULL_SECRET}}|${secret_value}|" "$input_file"
}

# Function to update Denodo Harbor User in YAML
update_denodo_harbor_user() {
  local harbor_user="$1"
  if [ -n "$harbor_user" ]; then
    sed -i "s|'{{PULL_CREDENTIALS_ENABLED}}'|true|" "$input_file"
  else
    sed -i "s|'{{PULL_CREDENTIALS_ENABLED}}'|false|" "$input_file"
  fi
  sed -i "s|{{DENODO_HARBOR_USER}}|${harbor_user}|" "$input_file"
}

# Function to update Denodo Harbor CLI Password in YAML
update_denodo_harbor_cli_password() {
  local cli_password="$1"
  sed -i "s|{{DENODO_HARBOR_CLI_PASSWORD}}|${cli_password}|" "$input_file"
}

# Function to update Denodo IP in YAML
update_denodo_ip() {
  local ip="$1"
  if [ -n "$ip" ]; then
    sed -i "s|{{DENODO_IP}}|${ip}|" "$input_file"
  fi
}

# Function to update Denodo User in YAML
update_denodo_user() {
  local user="$1"
  sed -i "s|{{DENODO_USER}}|${user}|" "$input_file"
}

# Function to update Denodo Password in YAML
update_denodo_password() {
  local password="$1"
  sed -i "s|{{DENODO_PASSWORD}}|${password}|" "$input_file"
}

# Function to update Use Role for Agora in YAML
update_use_role() {
  local use_role="$1"
  sed -i "s|{{USE_ROLE}}|${use_role}|" "$input_file"
}

# Function to update VM Size in YAML
update_vm_size() {
  local vm_size="$1"
  if [ -n "$vm_size" ]; then
    local cpu=$(echo "$vm_size" | awk -F'[:,)]' '{ for(i=1;i<=NF;i++) { if ($i ~ /CPU/) print $(i+1) } }' | tr -d ' ')
    local ram=$(echo "$vm_size" | awk -F'[:,()]' '{ for(i=1;i<=NF;i++) { if ($i ~ /RAM/) { split($(i+1), a, " "); print a[1] } } }' | tr -d ' ')
    if [ -n "$cpu" ] && [ -n "$ram" ]; then
      sed -i "s|'{{CPUS_PER_NODE}}'|${cpu}|" "$input_file"
      sed -i "s|'{{MEMORY_PER_NODE}}'|${ram}|" "$input_file"
    fi
  fi
}

# Function to Storage Class Name
update_storage_class_name() {
  local storage_class_name="$1"
  sed -i "s|{{STORAGE_CLASS_NAME}}|${storage_class_name}|" "$input_file"
}

# Function to update MPP Host in YAML
update_mpphost() {
  local mpphost="$1"
  sed -i "s|{{MPPHOST}}|${mpphost}|" "$input_file"
}

# Function to set the Managed identity usage to true in YAML
update_use_mi() {
  sed -i "s|{{USE_MANAGED_IDENTITY}}|true|" "$input_file"
}

# Update image registry if provided
update_image_registry "$image_registry_name"

# Update AKS node count if provided
update_aks_node_count "$aks_node_count"

# Update private load balancer annotation if requested
update_private_load_balancer "$private_load_balancer"

# Update pullSecret if provided
update_pull_secret_value "$pull_secret_value"

# Update Denodo Harbor User if provided
update_denodo_harbor_user "$denodo_harbor_user"

# Update Denodo Harbor CLI Password if provided
update_denodo_harbor_cli_password "$denodo_harbor_cli_password"

# Update Denodo IP if provided
update_denodo_ip "$denodo_ip"

# Update Denodo User if provided
update_denodo_user "$denodo_user"

# Update Denodo Password if provided
update_denodo_password "$denodo_password"

# Update Use Role for Agora if provided
update_use_role "$use_role"

# Update VM Size if provided
update_vm_size "$vm_size"

# Update Storage Class Name if provided
update_storage_class_name "$storage_class_name"

# Update MPP Host if provided
update_mpphost "$mpphost"

#Update enable Managed identities usage
update_use_mi

properties.scriptContent: echo -e "$values_file" > values.yaml; echo -e "$edit_values_script" > edit_template.sh ; ./edit_template.sh --input-file values.yaml --image-registry-name "$image_registry_name" --aks-node-count "$aks_node_count" --private-load-balancer "$private_load_balancer" --pull-secret-value "$pull_secret_value" --denodo-harbor-user "$denodo_harbor_user" --denodo-harbor-cli-password "$denodo_harbor_cli_password" --denodo-ip "$denodo_ip" --denodo-user "$denodo_user" --denodo-password "$denodo_password" --vm-size "$vm_size" --use-role "$use_role" --mpphost "$mpphost" ; az storage fs file upload -s values.yaml -p values.yaml -f $container_name --account-name $storage_name --auth-mode login

echo -e $template > deployment.json; az deployment group create --name $deployment_name --resource-group $resource_group --template-file deployment.json --parameters aksClusterVnetName=$vnet_name aksClusterSubnetName=$subnet_name subnetCidr=$subnet_cidr natGatewayName=$natgateway_name mainResourceGroup=$main_resourcegroup

presto-templates-download-command.value: [concat('az storage fs file download -f denodo-presto-k8scluster --account-name ', variables('prestoTemplatesStorageName'),' -p values.yaml -d ./values.yaml --account-key ',listKeys(resourceId('Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts', variables('prestoTemplatesStorageName')), providers('Microsoft.Storage', 'storageAccounts').apiVersions[0]).keys[0].value)]
